abstract: For much of the past decade, the Taiwanese manufacturer operated in relative obscurity as a contract manufacturer for many carriers.
snippet: For much of the past decade, the Taiwanese manufacturer operated in relative obscurity as a contract manufacturer for many carriers.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  When executives from Google and T-Mobile converge on a stage in New York Tuesday to unveil the first mobile phone powered by Google’s software, the event will be a coming-out party of sorts for another, far more obscure, but no less ambitious company  HTC.

headline.main: With Google Phone, HTC Comes Out of the Shadows
headline.print_headline: A Maker Of Phones, Speaking Up

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Laura M. Holson

abstract: Watch out, iPhone fans: The T-Mobile G1, the first cellphone running on Google’s software, is out.
snippet: Watch out, iPhone fans: The T-Mobile G1, the first cellphone running on Google’s software, is out.
lead_paragraph: Saul Hansell is at the T-Mobile and Google announcement of the first cellphone with Google’s much-ballyhooed Android software.

headline.main: Live Blog From the Google Phone Event

abstract: Google’s co-founders and city officials announced Tuesday a version of Google Maps with New York City mass transit information.
snippet: Google’s co-founders and city officials announced Tuesday a version of Google Maps with New York City mass transit information.
lead_paragraph: From our colleagues at City Room:

headline.main: Google Maps Now Includes New York Transit Info

abstract: The $179 T-Mobile G1 is the latest in a string of challenges to Apple’s popular iPhone.
snippet: The $179 T-Mobile G1 is the latest in a string of challenges to Apple’s popular iPhone.
lead_paragraph: In the latest of a string of challenges to Apple’s popular iPhone, Google and T-Mobile on Tuesday introduced the first mobile phone powered by Google’s Android software, which they hope will bring PC-like features to millions of cellphone users.

headline.main: Google Introduces a Phone With PC Features
headline.print_headline: Google and T-Mobile Introduce Phone With PC Features

abstract: Columnist David Pogue offers quick impressions of the new G1 cellphone from Google, HTC and T-Mobile.
snippet: Columnist David Pogue offers quick impressions of the new G1 cellphone from Google, HTC and T-Mobile.
lead_paragraph: From our colleague David Pogue on his Pogue’s Posts blog:

headline.main: David Pogue’s First Look at the Google Phone
